Key Match Events: Jaren Jackson Jr. had 35 points, 13 rebounds, and five assists to lead the Memphis Grizzlies to a 119-104 victory over the Dallas Mavericks.
Scotty Pippen Jr. finished with 18 points, while Jaylen Wells added 17 points and 11 rebounds.
P.J. Washington led the Mavericks with 17 points and 10 rebounds.
Naji Marshall finished with 16 points, while Klay Thompson and Jaden Hardy added 15 points each.
Dallas has lost five straight games.
Memphis went on a 10-2 run to take the lead back to 13 with 2:12 left in the game.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Mavericks were without leading scorer Luka Doncic due to a left calf strain and Kyrie Irving due to a bulging disk in his back.
Both teams were without their starting backcourts as injuries kept Ja Morant and Desmond Bane out for the Grizzlies.
Memphis, which is second in the league in points in the paint, finished with 52 points inside and outrebounded Dallas 55-50, including 13 offensive boards.
